text: Stumbled across this place on a Saturday morning, looking for breakfast.  It was outstanding!  I've spent a lot of time in S. Cal and Baja and love Mexican food.  This place may be my new favorite in Las Vegas.  I'd give five stars, but have only had breakfast, so I expect I'll upgrade to five stars when I've been for lunch or dinner (which will be soon).

We ordered chalupita mixta ,choriqueso and empanadas, ok flavor !!
Good preparadas!!:)
Very good portions! The owner will even make special orders for you if your feeling special. The caldo 7 mares is amazing will not disappoint ! Beautifully decorated
Ordered chalipita de ceviche! I do gotta say it was amazing. Yummmers! My bf ordered camarones ranchero and they were also yummy I recommend both.

We picked this place for Mother's Day breakfast. The service was absolutely disappointing. The server (owner) took over 20 minuets to take our drink order. She brought my moms coffee first, another 10 minutes later my horchata arrived on a dirty mug with michelada mix on half of the rim. I showed the other server lady because the owner once again wasn't around for another 20 minutes. She assured me the mug was clean just rubbed up against another mug. She acted like it was no big deal and like I was being picky. She asked if I wanted another I didn't want to wait another 10 minutes for a drink so I said no. Finally the owner came back to take our order. My mom ordered menudo, I ordered chicken enchiladas. The food came fast (about 10 minutes) my enchiladas were horrible. They were made from chicken scraps including chicken skin and all dark meat not breast at all. Iv never had enchiladas made from anything other than breast, even taco shops use breast meat. I showed the owner, she said they use chicken legs and no skin even though I was holding a piece of skin almost to her face. She said if I wanted breast they had items on the menu with breast. My mother was done with her meal by then. When I told her I didn't want anything she pick up the plate and rolled her eyes and walked away. I would never pay $12 for two enchiladas made from chicken legs. Another 10 minutes went by and still no check. My mom had to go to the register and ask for the check. The whole time the restaurant only had 5 table, they weren't that busy.

We spend $19 for menudo, a coffee and a horchata, I didn't drink. In conclusion the whole experience was not good, I would never go again to this place for any reason and I don't recommend this restaurant, not even to my worst enemy. We were just trying to have Mother's Day breakfast and left still hungry and wasted our morning. 

In a few words...you should better try Roberto's, Pepe's tacos or Taco Bell, at least you won't be there for 2 hrs waiting on horrible food. That bad!!

The food here is to die for! It taste just like a mexican mommas cooking! Classic recipes that have been perfected from the sauces to the tortillas. My family and I enjoy coming here very often. The decor represents the Mexican culture so perfectly as it celebrates Mexicos history. The whole atmosphere in this place makes you feel at home and the employees as so so helpful and nice. I recommend the enchiladas de pollo!

Stop being loyal to the big over priced chains of the lindos and the vivas, give this restaurant a try! My mom brought us here the last time she visited,  I had a shrimp cocktail which was full of shrimp and avocado. This was the first time I had a michellada, now I am in love with this drink, I crave it. My husband had a shrimp and tilapia dish which he described as delicious!  So we have visited a few times since,  every dish we order tastes fresh and recently cooked. But by far my favorite is the molcajete dish with the shrimp, chicken, steak,  potatoes and a hot sauce, to die for, perfect for a cold day, along with some hand made tortillas.....yumm! You must try the home made horchata!!!!!

I've been frequenting this restaurant for two months. Each dish- Sopa de Cameron, many platters of shrimps, ceviche, and fish dishes have been great. The appetizer salsa is wonderful. Great atmosphere with old Mexican historic photos and posters of Mexican film stars. The owner is so sweet, and perfectly attentive. They always have soccer playing on several screens when I am there, which I love. It's a home away from home for me. Highly recommended. Buen provecho!

Tonight I went to this restaurant we saw it had good reviews and we decide to go have dinner there my family and my Best friend with her son and sister and our friend ! Worse fucken decision Ever !!! Wish I can give 0 stars we got there lady came and gave us our menus and we Were looking through when she brings us chips and salsa chips were cold when she said they were a bit hot and salsa was rotten and we decide then we shouldn't eat here if we just got chips and salsa who knows what so we leave beacuse the lady was taking forever more then 5min to check if we are ready and we leave when she comes outside to tell us we need to pay for chips and salsa $5 we didn't even get drinks and eat the salsa just a few chips and my husband payed for burnt cold chips and bad fucken salsa ! Honestly worse Mexican restaurant ugh never again !

The posole was terrible the pork was like boiled and it wasn't tender and they didn't cook it with the juice or the hominy corn no flavor at all. I came here because of the reviews and the reviews are wrong

My boyfriend and I went here because it was recommended by his parents. This place was very friendly and welcoming. The drink size was huge, the meal size was huge and the flan was yummy. I had the chimichanga and my boyfriend had the burrito. Next time I'm going to try the tilapia. :))
Pretty terrible place. Food was mediocre. Lady gave me a rude attitude. The reason I don't give this place 1 star becuase I liked how clean they where.

Had to take care of some stuff in this part of town that I have never had any reason to visit.. On the way home, I spotted this place and had a sudden craving for a Mexican Seafood platter.

Mojarra Al Mojo De Ajo: A Whole Fried Tilapia sauteed in garlic  sauce and topped with more garlic sauce. Comes with beans, rice, salad green chile sauce and fresh handmade tortillas. 

 - The fish was fried perfrectly and tasted fresh from the sea, the garlic sauce was no joke (smothered with Garlic!) and extremely strong but I loved it, the green chile sauce was intensified with spices/heat but did not linger (Very nice!)
- Rice and Beans were typical and satisfying
- The Tortillas were Mesmerizing!! There is Absolutely No Comparison with store bought tortillas and their handmade tortillas served here.

Carne Asada Taco: Litlle diced meat, very soft, not much flavor but their red chile sauce, cliantro and onions, especially the handmade tortilla made it a success.

The Price was inexpensive for portion and taste, Place was decored surprisingly vibrant and server was helpful and kind. Would come here more often if it was closer!

I've lived around the corner from this place for years but never thought to go in until a few months ago. The service was good, and the homemade tortillas even better. 

If you come here, you must order the camarones a la diabla, and you must get extra tortillas. You will not be disappointed. 5 stars, no question.

Super Authentic and Delicious food along with a chill and friendly staff. The Mojarra with Garlic had thicks chunks of pure white fish that  was perfect for making fish tacos. They even provided me with extra tortillas which appear to be handmade in the restauraunt. They were awesome. Got a free triple scoop of strawberry ice cream with toppings for checking in!

Came here after a long day at work heard this place has great mexican food. I asked for a preparada de modelo so yummy and refreshing! I ordered the fajita de poll delicious I ate it so fast I forgot to take a picture. Love the music the atmosphere was welcoming ! Will be back for more really recommend

Thank you for the delicious food ! I've been a customer  for a while and will continue . You all have excellent fresh tasting food and I love your food ,one day I'll eat in but for now I'll order through Ubereats delivery.
Please don't forget to add the guacamole  and chips to menu and any other items you all have . This is some of the best Mexican food I've had since moving from California thank you !! Your food rate is 10 stars
The pozole was great...i love it and enjoy it and i will be coming back soon....great service
Love this place! My favorite Mexican restaurant. Friendly staff and great food. The price increased recently but It's ok. Doesn't change the fact that they're awesome!

Since I've moved to Vegas I haven't found 1 good Mexican spot, I'm so happy I found this place! I was looking for somewhere to have some posole decided to give this place a try and I'm happy I did good was on point my boyfriend loved his tacos, was a great experience great service, food, atmosphere so glad I went here I will now become a regular :)

Really enjoyed this place today for dinner! I love that the chips are freshly made! I started off with the seafood empanadas which I have never had and now they have set the bar high and I don't think I could try them anywhere else! It comes with this delicious green salsa! I got the shrimp cocktail which they do not skimp you on shrimp like most places do!! My wife ordered the pozole which she enjoyed she says the meat was super tender! I tasted it and have to agree the flavor was great! We will definitely be back to try other menu options and a Michelada since we forgot our IDs lol 

The service was great too! And it's a very clean place!

Love the atmosphere! Love the great food! Love the drinks!!!! Over all amazing! Exceeded my expectations! Will definitely be coming back! The waitresses are very polite and the manager or woman in charge was very nice! Couldn't get enough of that horchata either! I've gone to many Mexican restaurants and tried their horchata but this one is the best horchata in town! Definitely recommend!

If you want to eat great Mexican food that tastes amazing and is fresh, this is the place! I always stop by and eat here. I've been eating here for years, the atmosphere is great, the service is on spot and very friendly. Don't make the mistake of eating somewhere else, this is the place to eat!!! 
Try the" mar y mar " dish ( it's not in the menu, you have to request it) . You won't regret!
Found this place while visiting Vegas with friends and Family. Great food, Great service. Good menu. Authentic Mexican food.

Finally! We travel to the East side of Las Vegas and boy did I have a hankering for something special, home style and humble. I remember a long time as a young teenager that after going to Broadacres swap meet we ended up finding a Tejuino vendor and if you don't know what this is, it's a flavorful punch in the mouth of a drink from Jalisco, Mexico. 

After falling in love with this drink for it's flavorful and tangy taste, I quickly  realized that "Tejuino" was not widely available among traditional Mexican restaurants that Toni and I visited. I was on a mission, something special maybe a sit down place, maybe something that could satisfy. I had to find it. 

When searching, even google had a hard time searching for anything besides odd street vendor listings, which is amazing because back in the day, street vendors didn't even know what GPS was let along reviews. But good on em' for at least being listed but this wasn't what I was looking. 

After calling my father to see if he remembered a restaurant or sit down spot, he quickly directed me to "La Reyna". I was skeptical because not only did he know of a restaurant that specializes in Jalisco style Tejuino, he beet out Google and even gave me an address. So Toni and I were in a mission, and into my Ford Focus we went.

Now, I need anyone reading this to look past the location because I was not familiar with it and when I found it, it was not in a spot that I felt gave this place any credit. You will find a Market, some small style shops and La Reina last from the L-shape shopping lineup. But it was a diamond in the rough...

Walking in, it was a completely different atmosphere. Walls were lined with authentic Mexican film memorabilia and classic Mexican posters. The tables were somewhat clean on the top but had some sticky touch on the crease of the walls and some on the drink specials. Toni also picked up a small smudge on her finger from under the table and we didn't know what it was, napkins at the table would have been a good idea specifically for this. The soccer game that day was playing on the TV loud enough to hear the announcers but low enough to enjoy a conversation from any seating place in the building. 

As always, I had to take a look at the restrooms just to see if this was all a mirage but clean in the men's, will have to assume for the women's bathroom, sorry. We sat on the booth seats together facing the TV and was quickly greeted by an older lady that reminded me of my own family and was quickly transported to my grandmother's house. 

I quickly asked if they served Tejuino and she said that majical word, "Si, Como no?". Toni not understanding the magic, she quickly ordered a Coke, she didn't know what we were into. Once we received the menu, most had names and pictures which is my favorite type. Everything looked delicious and a combination of what I would get at my mother's/grandmother's house celebrating a family get together. 

Toni chose her tried and true Chicken Fajitas and I ventured into unknown territory with the "Mar I Tiera" plate. Toni's chicken fajitas had a traditional plate of shredded lettus with dressing, authentic beans with crumbled "queso fresco" on top and some rice along with the delicious rotisery chicken and veggie slices. At one point, a fly was buzzing around and due to randomness, it fell into Toni's coke. The older lady quickly brought a replacement coke but I thought they could use an industrial fly catcher to fix that problem completely. Toni doesn't impress easily, but she chowed down on her plate and said it was really good, which to me is one of the higher compliments you could get out of Toni. 

Toni also had bits off of my plate which came with the same salad, beans, rice combo but with carne asada, sauteed shrimp and veggies. I am very picky about my rice and beans but the entire time I could only think about the dedication and time it takes to get large amounts of rice and beans exactly to the quality I received that day.

Of course, while there, I only saw the older lady, and heard no one else having conversations in the back around the kitchen. I didn't know if they had a cook or another employee but it felt as though it was just the older lady, Toni amd myself. We might have been there in a slow time, but this place was empty and for what I just had, it didn't reflect the crowd to quality ratio in my opinion. 

At the end of it all, I had two large mugs of Tejuino and as I was paying our bill which was fair for what we had, I ordered a Tejuino to go. Knowing that it was going to be a long time before I would be to the east side of Las Vegas and enjoy the restaurant again from La Reyna but I knew it was worth the trip for the awesome food we had.

If you want to try or get Tejuino and equally great authentic dishes from Mexico, I recommend La Reyna. The small things that were a negative to us were overshadowed by the quality of food you receive. Enjoy and tell them I sent you!

This place is amazing !! I live on the east side so it's  war my home. Owner is so welcoming I love supporting my community and family owned business! Every time I go the lady makes me feel right at home and the portion size are generous. So delicious and authentic. I recommend caldo 7 mares if you like seafood or sea food place Mar y Mar. Best horchata in town !

We went today to La Reyna Mexican Rest and We weren't impressed.  We were expecting something better.  I had a Chile relleno combination and the rice was overcook and the beans just didn't taste good.  My husband had a Molcajete and it was not bad.  One thing i didn't like is that we got there we ordered a Jamaica drink and we were told that it wasn'r ready so the waitress told us to try the lemonade that it was fresh made, so we ordered 2 and when she came back it wasn't lemonade, was a margarita mix very very sweet and we were charged $7.00 for it.  Defenitelly we wont go back.

Me and my boyfriend  started coming to this restaurant few months ago and since then we made a habit of stopping here for dinner at least once a week. The food here is excellent,fresh and very flavorful. The atmosphere is very cozy, quiet and nice and the service, well the service is simply amazing. Ms Irina made all our visits here very pleasurable, we always feel welcome and valued. She is very friendly and a very nice person, she reminds me of a younger version of my grandmother and the whole experience here makes me feel like home. 
I strongly recommend this restaurant if you are in the area and you feel like eating good tasty Mexican food. Just give it a try once because if you don't try it you will never know what you are missing and i am pretty sure you will not be disappointed :)

This place fucking sucks. Don't go here bad service. The food is terrible, it really is upsetting how bad the food tastes. Not only does it taste terrible it's over priced. Don't go here. And I found a piece of sponge im my drink.

Came here because of the reviews. I ordered the ceviche de Camaron chalupita. It was pretty much aguachiles instead of ceviche since it was so spicy, but it was still good. My bf ordered a coctel... I think it was called la Reyna and it had pretty much everything in it but he had to add ketchup because he said it lacked flavor. Unfortunately it bf got sick and was up all night throwing up. He was sick all weekend from the food. I guess it wasn't such a good coctel after all. Hopefully no one else has gotten sick but be careful when going to
This place.
